title: Rockburn 2014 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)
description: Ripe melon slices dusted with cinnamon on the nose are followed by flavors of melon and pineapple. This is just off-dry in style,with ample weight balanced by crisp, mouthwatering acids on the finish.

title: Rooster Hill 2015 Estate Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Luscious cantaloupe, peach and yellow-cherry flavors burst from the nose and palate of this sun-kissed Riesling. It's forward and fruity with an approachably sunny, off-dry style and a refreshingly citrusy finish.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2018.

title: Viña Cobos 2013 Malbec (Perdriel)
description: Jammy and reduced on the nose, this smells gritty and gaseous. In the mouth, this is clampy and tannic. Medicinal flavors of blueberry are proprietary to this wine and frankly a touch green in the middle. That said, the heavy and herbal tasting finish seems fitting.

title: T.A.T.T NV Table Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is mostly Syrah (83%) along with dashes of Cabernet Sauvignon (14%) and Merlot. Aromas of blueberry, cherry and a spice top note are followed by plush, forward blue-fruit flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now.

title: Tedeschi 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: Aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, toasted hazelnut, dark spice, menthol and new leather emerge in the glass. The firm palate delivers dried black cherry, raisin, coffee and chewing tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide the framework. It finishes on a slightly bitter note.

title: Yves Leccia 2014 YL Rouge Red (Ile de Beauté)
description: This blend of Grenache and Niellucciu comes from vines that are up to 40 years old. It is a big, bold ripe and juicy wine, bursting with black plum and berry flavors. The wine is fruity enough to drink now, although it should age for at least 10 years.

title: Buttonwood 2013 Classic Cuvée Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a perfect wine, both in accessible flavors and somewhat affordable price, for pizza night or meatballs. Cooked red plum, strawberry and a bit of cracked pepper kick off the nose in the Cabernet Franc-led blend, with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. More plum hits the palate along with peppery spices, tobacco and marjoram. It's easy but not overly simple.

title: Bouza 2014 Reserva Tannat (Uruguay)
description: Grapy berry and plum aromas set up a fresh tannic wiry palate. Popping plum and berry flavors are lively and toasty, while this Tannat, with its black pepper notes, tastes good and spicy on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2014 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)
description: A unique blend of Viognier (50%), Roussanne (41%) and Riesling, this wine offers light notes of peach and pear. The palate is full of stone-fruit flavors backed by vibrant acidity that piques the interest.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Ethos Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tar, tire rubber, coffee, black fruit and spice lead to vanilla, cocoa and cherry flavors, with vanilla notes on the finish. The oak seems a bit heavy handed at times.

title: Clos de los Siete 2013 Red (Valle de Uco)
description: Its leafy, peppery, and spicy nose includes a dark, toasty component. Generous but pounding with tannins, this Malbec blend tastes of toasted blackberry and chocolate. An aggressive hot finish renders this fiery out the door. Drink through 2022.

title: Domaine Chenevières 2015 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)
description: This domaine is now sold through the Jean-Marc Brocard family. This is a rich wine with yellow fruit as well as crisper citrus. There is a touch of pepper that lifts the fine acidity and the ripe apple and peach. At the end, the wine is crisp and clean.

title: Angel Vine 2013 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Lively aromas of brambly red fruit and spice are followed by plump raspberry flavors. It shows a lot of freshness and purity.

title: Atwater 2013 Blanc de Blancs Méthode Champenoise Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Cutting, fresh apple, lemon and lime reverberate throughout this zesty Chardonnay sparkling wine. The palate is exceptionally fine in texture with a softly mouth-filling mousse. The finish is tinged by a pleasant swathe of green herbs and lime zest.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Servoisine Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: Vines over 45-years-old in the most northerly vineyard in Givry are the source of this rich smooth wine. It has a fine combination of blackberry fruits and pointed acidity that gives it a great lift. The balance is just right: the tannins comfortably part of the ripe fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2014 Terroir Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is produced from old-vine Pinot Noir planted on flint soil. The wood from the wine's aging does show, giving a spicy, smoky character that is still dominating the red-cherry fruits. This will balance out over the next few months to give a wine with concentration. The aftertaste brings out acidity. Drink from 2017.

title: Finca El Origen 2014 Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Wiry, slightly volatile aromas of blackberry and cassis come with rooty notes and a mild shot of vinegar. This feels solid and creamy, with lactic oak creating chewy weight. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and caramel are roasted and salty, while the finish tastes toasty, minty and oaky, with hard tannins.
designation: Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard

title: Fenestra 2011 Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: This robust red shows plenty of ripe berry flavors, firm texture and full body. It has a gripping mouthfeel and persistent raspberry and cranberry flavors that make the mouth water.

title: Fox Run 2012 Riesling 12 Hanging Delta Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: The 12 Hanging Delta Vineyard is a plusher, more decadent expression of grapefruit, mandarin orange and stone fruit flavors common to all of Fox Run's 2012 geology series. It's lip-smacking with sweetness and exceptionally light in body yet maintains an elegant, vibrant style. The finish is tinged by an earthier touch of smoked nuts and slate.

title: Merino 2014 Syrah (Limarí Valley)
description: Hailing from Limarí in Chile's north, this 2014 Syrah is different than most. Aromas of cassis, raspberry and blueberry are jammy and a touch exotic. In the mouth, this is narrow and jacked to the max with acidity. Flavors of raw foxy berry fruits finish long, peppery and minty, with drying tannins.

title: Market Vineyards 2012 Merval Malbec (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of vanilla, clove, cocoa, tar and plum are followed by generous purple-fruit flavors, speckled with baking-spice accents. It dips in the middle but otherwise shows a pretty sense of elegance.

title: Glenora 2015 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Equal parts fresh fruit and earthy complexity, this elegant off-dry wine offers loads of plush yellow peach, mango and yellow cherry flavors off set by undertones of crushed stone and soil. It's delectably juicy and vibrantly fresh through a moderately long finish.

title: Jamesport 2013 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Enticing complexities of bramble, rose and violet lend freshness to this ripe plummy Merlot. The palate is satisfyingly juicy, accented by crisp acidity and subtle notes of nuts and spice. A fine feathery layer of tannins cushions the finish.

title: Revelry 2013 Aerial Series Reserve Alder Ridge Vineyard Block 8 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: The aromas of green herb and wood spice don't seem entirely varietal. The flavors, however, are more convincing, with plush raspberry notes that appeal to the senses and carry through the finish.
designation: Aerial Series Reserve Alder Ridge Vineyard Block 8

title: Rideau 2014 Camp 4 Vineyard Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)
description: This is a versatile red wine, dark enough to hang with meat but light enough to work with heartier fish dishes and light pastas. Slightly dried cherry, plum and raspberry notes kick off the nose, and then the palate plays the acid card hard, offering tangy red plum, graphite and cured-meat flavors.

title: Page Mill Winery 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Delicious fruit flavors like boysenberry and red cherry make this wine burst with fruitiness. While full bodied, the texture is fresh and juicy, and all that ripeness fills the mouth and lingers on the finish.

title: Rooster Hill 2014 Reserve Estate Grown and Produced Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: A bit brawny on first impact, this full-bodied Lemberger offers a swift punch of ripe black cherry and berry flavors. The palate is intensely concentrated yet keenly balanced, lifted by a spray of zesty cranberry acidity and bold but fine-grained tannins. The finish is long and elegant.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is subtle but substantial, emphasizing supple texture and lively balance more than overt fruit flavors. It has a light Anjou pear aroma and conveys moderately tangy apple on the palate.

title: Graziano 2013 Grenache (Mendocino County)
description: Very ripe flavors make this wine seem almost sweet and the rich texture coats the mouth, augmenting the syrupy impression. Flavors suggest plump raspberries and fresh blackberries, while the finish brings out milk chocolate.
